exploration-guidance-rationale: It should probably provide more context for possible next steps.

visualization-helpful-rationale: Only the sweep figures give useful insights about what the data are.
visualization-issues-rationale: the red lines in the "Population Analysis" figure was not explained
visualization-structure-rationale: Getting the mean response was a good direction toward achieving some deep insight, but the other plots did not achieve this.

visualization-issues-rationale: I think one of the visualizations mentioned ROI masks but I could not tell if they were actually applied
visualization-structure-rationale: Nice display of the key data types
work-with-nwb-rationale: Really like the general dandiset summaries but some of the ways exploring / visualizing the individual NWB file is printed seem overly complicated (e.g. imaging plane and cell segmentation tables could be more simply displayed)

visualization-structure-rationale: The running speed visualization looks off to me, and the stim template visualization was showing a picture that looks like nonsense without any explanation.

access-data-rationale: Don't know the structure of the sessions in the dandiset. Eg. the long description talks about different areas, layers, and different sessions of training. Are there other dimensions? How would I identify which session is which?
exploration-guidance-rationale: The suggested analyses are too vague. Population dynamics with 18 rois is silly. Relate neural activity to behavior state when there is no sign of significant running (at least in the plot and summary statistics provided). Investigate predictive coding signatures in sequence learning?
prior-dandiset-familiarity-rationale: Familiar with Allen visual cortex data, not involved in this project.
understand-dandiset-rationale: The long description is helpful (though too long) but

visualization-issues-rationale: The first 100 stimulus intervals shows 4 intervals? with an unexplained gap. I think there are clearer ways to visualize this.

exploration-guidance-rationale: Ending future analyses mentioned epoch annotations for use of these recordings, but details into what the different epoch annotations mean or how to interpret were unclear
visualization-issues-rationale: I think the distributions of number of sweeps were unnecessary as well as the epoch duration statistics. Really liked the membrane potential with detected spikes visualization.
visualization-structure-rationale: think they were very helpful for illustrating general icephys relationships but did not give much deeper insight into this particular dandiset
work-with-nwb-rationale: I think the sweep table and relationship between response and stimulus information is unclear. Also how to work with the data in the context of the goals of the dandiset

review-confidence-rationale: Not familiar with this type of data and how it might get more in-depth
visualization-confidence-rationale: I don't think there is much data here to explore but the notebook also made that part clear

access-data-rationale: The structure of the NWB was not made clear.
understand-dandiset-rationale: There was no explanation for what the data in the file was. i.e. it says "using optogenetics" but provides no explanation beyond this that relates to the content.
unsupported-interpretations-rationale: The protocol-specified analysis had no explanation for what protocol is used and why it requires a specific analysis.
visualization-helpful-rationale: No context was provided for what the 'sweep' represent or how they relate to the experimental design.

visualization-issues-rationale: Really nice visualizations in this notebook

unsupported-interpretations-rationale: Not sure intensity is a proxy for diameter

visualization-issues-rationale: the "Visualizing Stimulus Timing" figure is unclear. What is in the gap space? Why is the x-axis only showing 24 to 40 seconds?
visualization-structure-rationale: The data stored in the file was represented independently, but no deeper patterns or relations were revealed or explained.

exploration-guidance-rationale: Without understanding the stimulus, I can't even begin to think about what to do with this.
prior-dandiset-familiarity-rationale: I'm not closely involved, but familiar with other Allen visual cortex data.
understand-dandiset-rationale: What are the variables across different sessions? What are the stimuli being used?
visualization-issues-rationale:
The plot of the stimulus template could use axis labels, and maybe it needs to be scaled appropriately. I believe the stimulus should be wider than it is tall, so I think it's on the wrong axis and that the axes aren't scaled the same. The code looks right that it's not plotting the time axis, but the aspect ratio doesn't look 540 X 240, it looks 960 X 240.
AND, this image doesn't make any sense. Either the experimenters used a stupid stimulus (on a stimulus monitor, the details in this are too small for mouse visual system) or this isn't the image being presented. I'm guessing the latter.
visualization-structure-rationale: The running wheel signal voltage is crazy. This is somewhat on the experimenters, this should be processed into a meaningful signal. But if this is what you are showing people, how are we supposed to use it? How do we interpret the big jumps?
work-with-nwb-rationale:
The units table has a ton of other information that is being ignored here.
Including important QC metrics, and maybe location information that is otherwise absent.

understand-dandiset-rationale: Nice that it pointed to the "ogen" files as containing the key session data, would be nice to know / see the interpretation what the other files are for.
visualization-helpful-rationale: The stimulus structure and timing information was a bit unclear . Eye tracking I think I could understand but the way of visualizing the data was not ideal. The analysis finding the most responsive unit did not seem to take the best approach, but overall the idea was clear and could be easily adapted.
visualization-issues-rationale: stimulus structure, eye tracking were the most difficult to interpret.
visualization-structure-rationale: It would be nice if they got closer to displaying the key result of the paper, but may be too challenging

understand-dandiset-rationale: The title lead me to believe there would be more exploration of the meaning of the data.
unsupported-interpretations-rationale: It was not clear that the purpose was to explain the structure of the NWB file.
visualization-helpful-rationale: They explained what the data represent (very broadly) and how they are structured. But not about what the data *mean* in the context of this file.

exploration-guidance-rationale: cross correlation and population dynamics aren't that feasible with 17 cells. I guess you can explore it, but I'd suggest someone pick a more suited dataset if that's the question. Comparison across session, subjects, behavior requires me to understand what the behavior is and what the session to session variables are. I know neither. Integration with behavior task, ditto. Advanced signal processing of calcium transients doesn't seem feasible here.
overall-helpfulness-rationale: It pulled out parts of one nwb file, but not completely.
understand-dandiset-rationale: It would be useful to create some sort of manifest of the dandiset. What are the variables across sessions? How would I decide which nwb file to examine?
visualization-confidence-rationale: Don't know how to access the behavior information.
visualization-helpful-rationale: Honestly, it makes me somewhat skeptical of this data. Which is good.
visualization-structure-rationale:
Showed the traces and masks well, but nothing about the task.

work-with-nwb-rationale: Why not should the behavioral task information? It's such a crucial part of the experiment.

visualization-helpful-rationale: The caveats about the data were especially helpful

I cannot tell if something is off with the data or the notebook

visualization-helpful-rationale: I appreciated the note on timing issues
